document_data.name: Southern Imaskari
document_data.mainbody: The '''Southern Imaskari languages''' were a group derived from [[Imaskari]] and spoken by the tribes of the southern parts of the [[Hordelands]].{{Cite dragon annual/1999/Speaking in Tongues|29}}
document_data.Description: The Southern Imaskari languages had hard, almost biting, consonants. The sound of l was strongly aspirated. The grammar followed a subject-object-verb word order.
document_data.Speakers: Most of the tribes speaking these languages were found in the central regions of the [[Endless Waste]], south of the [[Kora Shan]].
document_data.Languages: This grouping included [[Dalat language|Dalat]] and [[Tuigan language|Tuigan]]. [[Naican language|Naican]] was sometimes placed in this grouping or sometimes with the [[Northern Imaskari languages]]. [[Oigur language|Oigur]] and [[Quirish language|Quirish]] shared classification here and with the [[Eastern Imaskari languages]].
document_data.History: These languages shared most in common with [[Roushoum|ancient Imaskari]] but also had a strong [[Muhjuri]] influence.
